response.answer_text: Timbuktu is an ancient city in Mali, 20 km north of the Niger River, at the southern edge of the Sahara Desert in Africa. Historically, the city was a crossroads and an important market place. Timbuktu was metaphorically “the most distant place imaginable,” as the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) puts it. Why do we know Timbuktu? Its first documented use in this sense is dated to 1863. Phrases that develop this idea include “from here to Timbuktu” when describing a very long journey, or “from Timbuktu to Kalamazoo” (a city in Michigan, US). Before it was discovered by Europeans in 1830, all documented mentions of Timbuktu are about the efforts to get there, says OED revision editor Richard Shapiro. Even today, when the world has become a much smaller place, it remains relatively remote. Timbuktu Life in Timbuktu: how the ancient city of gold is slowly turning to dust Timbuktu (ca. 1100- ) • BlackPast Timbuctoo. Alfred, Lord Tennyson (1809-1892)

You can look this up on the Internet!! From Wikipedia: Timbuktu (pron.: /ˌtɪmbʌkˈtuː/), also spelled as Tinbuktu, Timbuctoo and Timbuktoo(Tamazight:ⵜⵉⵏⴱⵓⴽⵜⵓ (Tinbuktu); French: Tombouctou; Koyra Chiini: Tumbutu), is a historical and still-inhabited city in the West African nation of Mali, situated 20 km (12 mi) north of the River Niger on the southern edge of the Sahara Desert. The town is the capital of the Timbuktu Region, one of the eight administrative regions of Mali. (…)

Timbuktu is a historical city located in Mali :  It was formed during the 11th - 12th century and was a major city in the Mali Empire.  Many people around the world, think that Timbuktu is a myth but the city actually exists.

Located at the gateway to the Sahara desert, within the confines of the fertile zone of the Sudan and in an exceptionally propitious site near to the river, Timbuktu is one of the cities of Africa whose name is the most heavily charged with history.

A2A. It's spelled “Timbuktu,” and it’s a city in Mali (a landlocked country in northwestern Africa which looks kind of like a cat’s head and neck in profile) where there’s a lot of awesome Sudano-Sahelian architecture. Hope that helps.

Timbuktu is an ancient city in Mali, situated 20 km north of the Niger River. The town is the capital of the Timbuktu Region, one of the eight administrative regions of Mali. (Thanks Wikipedia) Timbuktu - Wikipedia
Timbuktu is a city in Mali 20 km (12 mi) north of the Niger River. It is famous for its mosque and university which were both founded in the early 1300's during the Mali Empire period.
I don’t know anything about Timbaktu, but I know about Timbuktu from an rapid google search: Timbuktu Maybe it helps.
Timbuktu is a city in Mali, if that is what you are trying to say.
Timbuktu is a town in Mali, Africa: Timbuktu - Wikipedia
